in-an-era-when-the-bass-has-grown-dramat.title: In An Era When The Bass Has Grown Dramatically In Popularity, Spanning From Jazz And Rock To R B And Funk, Jons Book Is A Great Musical Source For All Bass Players. It Provides A Comprehensive Source Of Instruction For Beginners And Experienced Players Alike. In Addition, It Offers A Full Range Of Exercises As Well As A Complete Discography Of Dozens Of Bass Players For Easy Listening. Funkfusion Bass Is An Enlightening And Refreshing Book. I Recommend It Highly.

introduction-the-purpose-of-this-book-is.title: Introduction The Purpose Of This Book Is To Introduce Todays Bass Player To The Funkfusion Style Of Playing. Throughout The Book, Wei1 Keep In Mind The Role Of The Bass Player, As I Teach You What To Do And What Not To Do. There Are A Lot Of Players With Plenty Of Chops Who Have Strong Fingers And Can Play Very Fast Even Loud But Who Cares Remember, You Wont Get Called For Gigs Or Recording Sessions Based On How Fast You Play, What Kind Of Bass You Have, How Much Money You Have Invested In Equipment Or The Fact That Your Friend Has A Cousin Who Knows A Guy In L.a. Who Is Supposed To Have Really Good Connections. We Bass Players Need To Groove, Plain And Simple. Throughout This Book, Well Concentrate On Under- Pe T E Me E Ve Ae

schmoozingnetworking-thing-having-the-ri.title: Schmoozingnetworking Thing. Having The Right Equipment Is Very Important, Too. It Never Hurts To Be A Great Reader. Being Responsible And Reliable Isnt Bad Either. But None Of This Stuff Will Do You Any Good If You Arent Able To Groove. My Ability To Help You With Those Other Types Of Things Is Somewhat Limited. I Can Help You, Though, With Your Soloing.  Should Be Clear That Soloing, Flashiness And Showiness Take A Back Seat To Laying Down The Time And Grooving. If It Isnt, Re-read This Page As Many Times As Necessary. If That Still Doesnt Do The Trick, Get A Hold Of Funk Bass And Study It Inside Out. If You Still Dont Get The Joke, Ask Yourself Why Nobody Calls You For Gigs Now That Lve Given My Disclaimer, We Can Talk About Chapter 6. There Is A Time And Place Where Its Okay To Show Off And Strut Your Stuff. Chapter 6 Includes Several Different Licks That Can Be Incorpo- Rated Into Your Solos To Add That Certain Pizazz. Have Fun Here, But Remember To Keep Things In Perspec-

back-we-go-one-again-to-the-honesty-cate.title: Back We Go, One Again, To The Honesty Category. You Think You Know What Your Playing Sounds Like Try Laying It Down On Tape And See Hear If Youre Right. Tape Recorders Dont Lie. Recording Your Playing May Reveal Many Flaws And Bad Habits Of Which You May Not Have Been Aware. It Lets You Really Zero In On The Attack And Release Of Each Note, As Well As Your Sustain, Intonation, Fime Feel And Overall Sound. Tape Recorder Can Be An Invaluable Practice Tool. Another Great Way To Practice Is To Learn Bass Grooves From Records, And Then Play Along With Them. Use Your Tape Recorder To Compare Your Line With Marcus Millers Line And See How It Measures Up. Lm Not Saying You Should Try To Sound Like Marcus, But If You Think Youre Putting All The Notes In The Right Places And It Still Isnt Quite Happening, Try To Pinpoint What It Is About Your Playing That Sounds Different Than The Record. Keep In Mind Though, All The Variables Involved In Creating Music, Like The Player, Strings, Attack, Electronics And Effects, Plus The Fact That Marcus Bass Is Mixed With All The Other

getting-started-evolution-of-the-bass-ev.title: Getting Started Evolution Of The Bass Ever Wonder Where We Came From And How We Got Here Lm Speaking, Not So Much In A Philo- Sophical Sense, But Rather, A Bassic One. How Did It Occur To Brian Bromberg And Steve Bailey To Sud- Denly Turn Their Left Thumb Into A Fifth Finger Once They Reached A Certain Register On The Electric Bass What Inspired Anthony Jackson And John Patitucci To Expand The Range Of The Bass So Dramatically Pn A A E Re Aepataaa St Aesco Pn

bass-including-serge-koussevitsky-paul-h.title: Bass, Including Serge Koussevitsky, Paul Hindemith And Reinhold Gliere. Today, Too, The Literature For Double Bass Continues To Grow, Through The Works Of Frank Proto, John Deak, Franois Rabbath And Other Noted Composers. There Is A Steadily Growing Number Of Double Bass Virtuosos, Too, Including Gary Karr, Edgar Meyer, Barry Green, Thomas Martin, Klaus Trumpf And Several Others. Jazz Jumping Back To The Early Twentieth Century, When The Whole Jazz Movement Was Increasing In Popularity, The Bass, Once Again, Found Its Niche. Around 1940, A Man  Of Jimmy Blanton Began Playing Bass With The Duke Ellington Orchestra. music-is-usually-referred-to-as-jazzrock.title: Music Is Usually Referred To As Jazzrock Fusion, Or Simply, Fusion. Some Of The Early Fusion Groups And Artists Included Weather Report, Return To Forever, The Brecker Brothers, Billy Cobham, Jean-luc Ponty, The Crusaders, Mahavishnu, Tom Scott, Dave Grusin And Others. And Of Course, We Cant Forget The Bass Players Who Contributed Such A Vital Part To This Music. Among The Bass Heroes Of This Decade Were Jerry Jemmott, Anthony Jackson, Chuck Rainey, Verdine White, Alphonso Johnson, Francis Rocco Prestia, Jaco Pastorius, Will Lee, Neil Jason, Stanley Clarke, Louis Johnson, Randy Jackson And So Many Others. The Edison Influence, Part Ii

can-you-answer-the-questions-posed-at-th.title: , Can You Answer The Questions Posed At The Beginning Of This Chapter Any Guesses As To Why Bailey And Bromberg Use Their Left Thumb As A Fifth Finger When They Reach The Upper Register On The Electric Bass The Answer Is Simple. This Technique, Known As Thumb Position, Is The Proper Way To Play In The Upper Register On An Upright Bass If There Is Such A Thing As Proper Any More. If You Ever Get A Chance To See Either One Of These Guys Perform, This Technique Is Quite A Sight. You Ought To See Brian Use His Dazzling Two-handed Tapping Technique On The Upright, Too. Proper Yeah, Right And How Did The Six-string Bass Come About Anybody Whos Ever Heard Anthony Jackson Or John Patitucci Knows The Answer To This Question. As Weve Discussed, Bass Players Have Been Able To Accom- Plish Quite A Bit Over The Centuries, Using Only Four Strings. Then Along Come Anthony And John, Who Have So Much More To Say On The Instrument That It Had To Be Expanded In Order For Them To Express Themselves To The Fullest. In Listening To Anthony Jackson, Vouil Find That He Takes Care Of Business On

exercise-02-1-it-may-look-simple-enough-.title: Exercise 02 - .1. It May Look Simple Enough At First Glance. In Order To Build A Solid Foundation, Though, We Must Make Sure Our Playing Is Clean And Accurate. This Exercise Starts With The Second Finger On The Right Hand And Alternates 2-1-2-1, Etc. Youil Need To Make Sure Cach Note Rings Clearly. Make Sure, Also, That The Notes Sound Flowing And Connected, Rather That Choked. Your Fingers Should Not Be Totally Straight Nor Too Curled Up, But Rather, Slightly Rounded. Position Your Left Hand So That Each Finger Hovers Over A Different Fret, Always Ready To Press Down On The String See Photos. Practice Very Slowly And Deliberately, Concentrating On Precision. String Crossings

mastering-the-two-finger-technique-thoug.title: Mastering The Two-finger Technique Though We Dont Know Exactly Where Were Headed, We Do Know From Whence We Came, And Thaes A Pretty Good Place To Start. We Dont Have To Go All The Way Back To Pre-bach Times, But We Can Go Back To The Time When The Electric Bass Was First Perfected. Before Were Ready To Start Making Real Music With The Bass, Weil Have To Put Some Time And Effort Into Technique, Pure And Simple. Wei1 Start Out Very Basic And Eventually Gradually Develop These Examples Into Some Very Advanced Exercises. Move At Your Own Pace And Dont Rush Through Any Of These Drills. you-ll-notice-also-that-when-the-notes-a.title: You'll Notice, Also, That When The Notes Are In The Extreme Upper Register, Sometimes L Use The Sva Symbol And Sometimes Write The Notes Out. This Is To Get You Used To Reading More Than One Kind Of Notation. Also, There May Be Times When Til Have You Play A Note On One String When Vou D Much Rather Play It On An Open String. Have A Reason For Everything, Hcre. Playing Open Strings Is Casy. Sometimes, However, You May Be Playing At A Slow Tempo Where An Open String Would Take Away All The Expression And The Feeling That You Need To Put Into The Music That Cant Be Achieved With An Open String. variations-of-major-scales-now-let-s-try.title: Variations Of Major Scales Now Let's Try Another Variation. Practicing This Exercise Will Give You Tremendous Facility In Both Hands And Will Help You Build Technique, Strength And Endurance. Once You Become Familiar With This Pattern, Be Sure To Practice It In All Twvelve Keys See If You Can Come Up With Some Of Your Own Finger- Ings That Are Logical And Facilitate Smooth Shifts On The Fingerboard. Or Maybe You Have A Teacher That Would Like You To Use A Particular Fingering. In Any Case, Dont Just Practice In E Major. In Fact, You Might Even Want To Use Your Music Note- Book To Write This Pattern Out In All The Keys Be Sure To Include F And Gb, B And Ct And Cf And D. Iv'11 Be Great Experience For You I Deliberately Did Not Write Them All Out For You. Coming Up With Your Own Fingerings Will Help You Leam Them More Effectively And Remember Them More Easily Whether You Actu- Ally Write Them Out Or Not. Be Surc To Practice In Moderation. chapter-3-studies-in-string-crossings-no.title: Chapter 3 Studies In String Crossings Now That We've Got Both Hands Wide Awake, All Warmed Up And Gencrally Fecling Pretty Strong, Lets Take Our Playing To The Next Level. After Becoming Proficient With Scales And Arpeggio Studies, A Logical Step To Take Is To Isolate Musical Passages That Require The Hands To Jump From One String To Another. Obviously, This Action Will Involve Both Hands, Though The Hand That Usually Requires The Most Effort In Mastering This Technique Is The Right Hand. The Excrcises In This Chapter Will Help You Develop And Strengthen Your String-crossing Abilities. Concentrate On Kccping The Music Flowing Cleanly, Cfficiently And Evenly. Be Careful, Also, Not To Allow Any Extrancous Noise, Or String Ring. style-elements-before-we-get-into-some-s.title: Style Elements Before We Get Into Some Serious Grooving, Let's Review Some Of The Basic Elements Of Style, Which Will Make Your Music Sound More Interesting, As Well As Help You Add Personality To Your Playing Youre Probably Familiar With Many Of These Techniques, But A Good Review Never Hurts. Besides, It Will Give You A Chance To Build Upon What You Mzy Already Know, And Improve Your Overall Ability. The Hammer-on. A Hammer-on Produces A Note By Slamming A Finger Onto The Fingerboard, As Opposed To Actually Plucking The String. In Most Cases, A Previous Note Has Bcen Struck And Is Still Ring- Ing On The Same String, Adding Momentum To The Hammer-on. However, It Is Also Possible For A Note To Be Produced -on Technique, Itself, Although This Technique Requires Extra Effort In The Left-

the-shake-like-the-trill-the-shake-is-an.title: The Shake. Like The Trill, The Shake Is An Alternating Of Two Notes On One Strine, Usually Fast. The Difference, However, Is That The Shake Produces Both Notes With The Same Finger, Sliding Back And Forth, Rather Than Two Fingers Hammering On And Pulling Off. The Result Is A Completely Different Sound. Shnkes Are A Little Harder To Play Smoothly At First, So You'll Have To Apply A Little Extra Effort Once You Get It Down, Though, The Effort Will Be Worth It. 10s This Kind Of Technique That Distinguishes Someone Who Just Plays The Notes Not That 1ere's Anything Really Wrong With That And Someone Who Adds A Litle Of Them- Selves To The Music, Injecting Personality And Making The Music More Interesting To Listen To, While Keeping Right Along With Taking Care Of Business And Grooving With That Great Time Fecl. the-bend-no-it-s-not-the-kind-of-bends-y.title: The Bend. No, It's Not The Kind Of Bends You Get When You Go Swimming Too Soon After Lunch Actually, This Is A Way To Alter The Pitch Of A Note, Without Moving To Another Fret Listen To Any Rock Or Blues Guitar Player If You Don't Know What L'm Talking About. Bending The String Up Or Down Will Raise The Pitch Of The Note. The Amount The Pitch Is Raised Depends, Of Course, On How Much You Bend The String. Be Careful With This One, Though. If You Use This Technique Too Much, It Might Sound Kind Of Comy. If You Use It Spar- Ingly And Tastefully, It Can Add A Little Spice To Your Playing. Think Of These Techniques As Garlica Little Bit Goes A Long Way, But Too Much Is Like Well, You Know. _0m E 05e -053 D _.e__.,__i__.f Ii M N

chapter-5-establishing-a-groove-so-what-.title: Chapter 5 Establishing A Groove So What's It All About, Anyway Assuming Youve Been Going Through This Book One Step At A Time, In Order, Following My Instructions To The Letter If You Havent, First Of All, Shame On You, Second Of All, Go Back And Do It Right From The Beginning, Youve Got The Underlying Concept Of What Were Trying To Do, You Have Some New Insights Into How To Practice, You Know Your Scales And Arpeggios Inside And Out Hopefully Not Just The Major Scales, Youre Really Great At String Crossings And You Can Hammer-on, Pull-off, S'ide, Trill, Shake And Bend Like Nobody's Business What Do You Say We Take All This Informa- Tion And Make Some Music Out Of It The Examples In This Chapter Notice How I Didnt Refer To Them As Exercises Are Intended To Be Played Over And Over Again With Your Drum Machine, Or Better Yet, A Real Live Drummer. Concentrate On

chapter-6-building-a-vocabulary-for-funk.title: Chapter 6 Building A Vocabulary For Funkfusion Soloing 1 Was Tempted To Lcave This Chapter Out Of The Book, Fearing It Might Fall Into The Wrong Hands Or Be Misunderstood. As You All Know Very Well By Now, Your Job As A Funkfusion Bassist Is, Along With The Drummer, To Lay Down The Musical Foundation, Thus Supporting The Rest Of The Band, And To Groove With A Great Time Feel If You Dont Know That , Start The Book Over Again. There Is A Time And Place For Everything, Including, Soloing And Even, Yes, Showing Off. Please Be Careful And Only Show Off At The Appropriate Time And Only When You Are Called Upon To Do So Which Is, Absolutely, The Minori- Ty Of The Time. You Must Remember, Too, That When Your Solo Is Over, Its Over And Its Time To Get Right Back To The Business At Hand, Which Is Together, Now .. . Laying Down The Groove. discography-you-can-certainly-gain-a-gre.title: Discography You Can Certainly Gain A Great Deal Of Benefit From This Book  Exercises, Studying The Grooves And Using The Recorded Supplement As A Guide. But Why Stop Therc The Best Way To Get A Grasp Of A Musical Concept Is To Irr. Nerse Yourself In It. Listen To It As Much As Possible And Try To Imitate What You Hear. Then Listen Some More. And Then Imitate Some Morc. Sometimes You'il Want To Analyze What You Hear. Other Times You May Just Want To Let It All Soak In Without Giving It Any Thought. The More Varicty You Incorporate Into Your Playing And Listening, The More Interesting Youil Find The Music And The Morc Interested Youil Sound When You Play. Compare Different Players And Their Styles And Start Asking Some Questions, Why Does Gary Willis S.und Difterent Than Jeff Berlin What Is It About Anthony Jackson And Abe Laboriel That Makes So Many Producers Call Them For So Many Recording Sessions How Come We Can Spot Jaco's Playing A Mile Away

dr-jazz-of-dr-jazz-operations-oak-park-m.title: Dr. Jazz Of Dr. Jazz Operations. Oak Park, Michigan. Well, Doc, Thanks Again For Letting Me Browse Through Your Seemingly Endless Library Of Lps, Cds And All That Other Stuff You've Got In Your Giant Vault. The Discography In This Book Is Significantly Becfed Up, Thanks To You. Call Me Any Time You Need A Favor Except To Help You Move. Chcers Murray Goldenberg Of Goldenberg Photography, Southfield, Michigan. You Do Great Work, Murr You Can Hardly See Any Of My Gray Hairs. Let's Keep It Our Secret Thanks. Rey Sanchez. Though We Don't Live Near Each Other Any More, Don't Really See Cach Other Very Often, Havent Talked In A While Hey, Man, Give Me A Call, You'il Always Be The Onc Who Got Me Into The Book Writing Business. Muchas Gracias, Amigo Dale Titus, Bassist Extraordinaire And Writer Par Excellence Not To Mention, All-around Good Guv. You
